newsitem.title: USA: Columbia/HCA executives gave false info - NYT.
newsitem.headline: Columbia/HCA executives gave false info - NYT.

text.p: Evidence has been obtained in the investigation of the Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp that some hospital executives responsible for obtaining reimbursement from Medicare submitted false information to the government, The New York Times said.

In Friday's edition, the paper cited people with knowledge of the investigation who said the first indictments based on this evidence are expected to come as early as within a few months in Florida, charging that those executives helped submit reports that inflated hospital costs.
Those cost reports are used to calculate federal payments that bring hundreds of millions of dollars to Columbia every year, the newspaper said.
The charges would be the first indictments in the Columbia investigation, the paper said.
Earlier in the week, the FBI said it executed search warrants on Columbia sites in six states.
